question_text: Which of the following best describes a critical installation step when inserting an M.2 SSD into a laptop?
answer_options: Pushing it flat into the tray and applying thermal adhesive
Sliding it into the slot at an angle and securing it with a screw
Pressing it into the RAM socket before replacing the bezel
correct_answer: Sliding it into the slot at an angle and securing it with a screw
explanation: M.2 drives are inserted at an angle and held in place by a single retention screw, as described in the transcript.
